annotations.description: The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. The home side dominated today's game. The home side's strategy was to maintain possession and put the opponent out of the game. While the visitors focused more on defence and catching their opponent on the break.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The substitution has been made. Joel Matip (Liverpool) has replaced Georginio Wijnaldum.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here is a change. Leroy Fer is going off and Paul Clement gives the last tactical orders to Jay Fulton (Swansea).
The linesman raises his flag as one of the players from Liverpool was in an offside position.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Leroy Fer (Swansea) requires medical treatment, so the referee stops play and signals for the physio to come onto the pitch.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Lukasz Fabianski intercepts the ball.
Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) has picked up a minor injury, but it looks like he will be able to continue.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: The game is interrupted now, Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 5 min. of added time.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. We witnessed a quite balanced game. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible. The away team, on the other hand, played long ball football.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Leroy Fer (Swansea) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) sends a cross into the box from the free kick, but his effort lacks accuracy and goes well out of play.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a precise pass. He pulls the trigger but only hits one of the opposition, who gets in the way of his effort.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fernando Llorente trots off the pitch and is replaced by Borja Baston (Swansea).
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Kevin Friend no option but to blow his whistle.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) decides to strike the ball towards goal, but his effort fails to threaten the goalkeeper after being well blocked by one of the defenders.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) sends in a pass which fails to reach any of his teammates.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: James Milner (Liverpool) takes the corner kick and sends a lovely ball into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence is ready and knocks the ball to safety.

Great solo effort by Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) as he beats two defenders before firing in a drive from just outside of the box towards the roof of the net. The goalkeeper is ready and makes an amazing save. Liverpool force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Today's match ends for Martin Olsson who will be replaced by Angel Rangel (Swansea).
Martin Olsson (Swansea) attempted to create a dangerous situation in front of goal by sending a cross into the box, but the defence easily dealt with the threat.

Lukasz Fabianski can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close range effort from Divock Origi (Liverpool). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: James Milner (Liverpool) will take a corner kick.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The ball is whipped in from the corner by James Milner (Liverpool), but one of the defenders gets it clear.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders. It will be a corner kick for Liverpool.

Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat. The referee blows his whistle, Liverpool are awarded a corner kick.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:3.
James Milner (Liverpool) receives the ball from the set piece on the edge of the box, but fails to score because his shot is blocked.
It looks like Wayne Routledge (Swansea) saw red with that tackle. Kevin Friend won't tolerate such behaviour on the pitch and blows for a foul.
Divock Origi (Liverpool) whips a promising cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) attempts to find one of his teammates with a fine lofted pass, but the defence reacts well to intercept the effort.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: That will be all from Emre Can who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Divock Origi (Liverpool).

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum puts a cross into the box and finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 2:2.

annotations.description: James Milner (Liverpool) swings in the corner, but fails to find any of his teammates. One of the defenders reacts superbly to get it clear.

The foul by Emre Can (Liverpool) was seen by Kevin Friend who didn't hesitate to blow the whistle.
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.

The game can't be described as attractive. We are hoping against hope that the second half will bring more exciting moments and goal opportunities. The hosts were superior in their performance in the first half. They were more active and precise. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away team adopt a defensive style of play.

Hello and welcome to our minute by minute commentary of the upcoming clash. We will try to provide you with as accurate as possible picture of the happenings on the pitch. Have fun.
Swansea have gone 3 consecutive matches without a draw.
Gylfi Sigurdsson has the most assists (13) for Swansea this season.
Sadio Mane looks sharp as he's the top goal scorer for Liverpool with 12 goals in the competition.

The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. The home side dominated today's game. The home side's strategy was to maintain possession and put the opponent out of the game. While the visitors focused more on defence and catching their opponent on the break.
